trial_identification.studytitle: Bovine Lactoferrin for treatment of anaemia associated with advanced cancer
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Bovine Lactoferrin for the treatment of anaemia associated with cancer cachexia related to underlying stage IV non-small cell lung cancer'

interventions.interventions:
Oral administration of 250 mg, 500 mg of bovine lactoferrin once daily for 12 weeks
, one arm will receive 250 mg bovine Lactoferrin, one arm will receive 500 mg of bovine Lactoferrin and one arm will receive placebo. and the apparent healthy will receive 250 mg bovine Lactoferrin
All the group one tablet once daily
We will have one week trial for adherence to the drug by giving a period of one week placebo and those who are compliant with the placebo for one week by more than 85 % will be included in the study
interventions.comparator:
RCT, single blinded, two group of controls, apparent healthy, the other group patients with cacherxia related to underlying stage IV non-small cell lung cancer
We have two controls, one will receive placebo and the apparent healthy will receive 250 mg of bovine lactoferrin Cachexia control group will receive placebo (microcellulose tablets). Apparent healthy group will receive 250 mg bovine Lactoferrin

primaryOutcome.outcome: We will measure haemoglobin concentration by using blood samples on two occasions, 1st before starting the study as baseline and 2nd sample will be taken after 12 weeks (end of the study).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change in serum level of iron
Change in red blood cells (RBCs) count

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients with cachexia related to underlying stage IV non-small cell lung cancer, Apparent healthy controls should not being diagnosed with any type of cancer or have been treated from cancer.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Metastasis in the brain or in bone, patients with severe illness, unstable angina, congestive heart failure, heart attack during the last month, cognitive impairment, unable to give a consent.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: School of Medicine, 75 Pigdons Road, Waurn Ponds VIC, 3220

75 Pigdons Road, Waurn Ponds VIC 3220
Deakin University

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Our hypothesis is bovine lactoferrin may increase level of haemoglobin in patients with cachexia related to underlying stage IV non-small cell lung cancer. Our primary object is to compare the level of haemoglobin in comparison with the placebo, after adminstration of 250 my of bovine lactoferrin. The secondary object is the comparison with the placebo ,the effect of two different doses of bovine lactoferrin 250 mg versus 500 mg and will check the effect on increase in serum iron, red blood cell count and haemoglobin concentration. Also to compare the effect of 250 mg of bovine lactoferrin in cancer cachexia versus apparent healthy
